channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken man hole cover 400x400x70mm, 11th June
item.description:
Sunken man hole cover, on the A40 travelling westbound. Immediately after passing Dowdeswell reservoir on the left, approximately 150m before the junction on the right for Lower Dowdeswell. Or Alternatively 160m before the Dowdeswell woods car park on the left. As can be seen in the pictures it's approximately 30m before the bus stop lay by on the left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights problem, 10th June
item.description:
While I was out on my walk this week I came up to the recently overhauled traffic lights.I was walking from the Cheltenham side and got to the lights to walk over in the direction of Gloucester/Churchdown etc Despite me pressing the control buzzer and waiting for ages to cross,I counted 3 times traffic from all areas came across the crossroads before the lights changed to green for me to cross.Surely this should be changed to allow pedestrians to cross more easily and speedily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bamfurlong Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes/drop in height entering car park, 10th June
item.description:
At the entrance to the car park, there is a significant drop in height where the road/junction to car park has sunk. Itâ€™s near impossible to drive a car out without scrapping it, unless you have a 4x4. The same is also true further up the entrance into the car park (past the yellow barrier) where rain water has caused a large chanel in the road to form.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 10th June
item.description:
Customer reports that the Temporary TS at the location are out of sync with the permanent signals on the crossroads of Moorend Park Road and the Shurdington Road. Therefore, the traffic is unable to flow and is building up and getting stuck in the roadworks. The signals are currently unmanned, which was a measure introduced previously to prevent such an issue arising.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Gloucester Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Several dead branches on silver birch, 10th June
item.description:
Directly outside 36 Kings Road Cheltenham GL52 6BG. There are several dead branches on this tree, which have been reported previously (and indeed about three years ago). The tree is clearly not healthy, and we are concerned that the dead branches will eventually fall off onto cars or people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead branch in tree and branch around cable, 10th June
item.description:
Tree outside 132 old Bath Road has a visible dead branch as well as having a second brand around a street phone cable. Generally tree needs sorting. It is also reaching well onto our property and we would love it taking back too. Lovely tree just needs some attention. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
